measured_by: Offset (average Euclidean distance between recorded and target gaze coordinates)
justification: "The accuracy is measured by the offset, which is the average Euclidian distance … between the recorded gaze coordinates … and the true gaze coordinates."

measured_by: Root-mean square error (RMSE) of gaze points
justification: "The precision is … calculated as the root-mean square (RMSE) of the Euclidean distances … High values of RMSE indicate … low precision."

measured_by: Hit ratio (percentage of gaze points within 15 % of target)
justification: "The hit ratio is defined as the relative number of gaze points within a range of 15 % of the screen size around the target stimulus…"
"The Option Index measures the relative number of gaze points on the LL-versus the SS-choice option."
"The Attribute Index measures the relative number of gaze points on the amount versus the time attributes."
construct: Gaze distribution between amount and time attributes

justification: "The Payne Index … measures the relative numbers of gaze transitions between the same attribute across options … versus the number of transitions within options."

measured_by: Discounting parameter k from hyperbolic discounting model
justification: "We fitted a participant-specific discounting parameter k based on the participants' choice behavior in a hyperbolic discounting model."
